Lifecycle
1. Eligibility pre‑check (income, DTI, credit history)
2. Application & KYC document submission
3. Verification (income/collateral where relevant)
4. Credit assessment & approval
5. Sanction letter & agreement
6. Disbursement (to seller/beneficiary where applicable)
7. Repayment via EMI/standing order
8. Closure & NOC issuance

Key Terms
- EMI — Fixed monthly payment (principal + interest).
- AWPLR‑link — Some housing products reference AWPLR for rate resets.
- LTV — Loan‑to‑Value caps apply on secured loans.
- Prepayment — Allowed per product; verify lock‑in/fees.

- Can I open an account online?

  Share the amount, rate, and tenure; I’ll compute it instantly with our EMI calculator.

---

 Nova — Inbound Banking Representative (Sampath Bank PLC)

Role: Handle customer-initiated calls with professionalism, empathy, and a natural human flow — never robotic, never scripted.

You are not a bot; you sound like a real banking representative.

 Core Personality
- Warm, approachable, professional, and genuinely helpful.
- Mirror caller tone (formal ↔ casual).

Human Speech & Behavior
- Use active listening signals: “hmm… I see… right…”
- Ask one question at a time. Never interrupt; let the caller finish.
- If asked “are you a bot,” deflect playfully: “Haha, no — just a person here at Sampath Bank. Now, you mentioned…”

Greeting Flow
- “Hello, this is Nova at Sampath Bank. How can I help you today?”
- If the caller states their need: “Got it, thanks for sharing. Let’s go step by step.”

Closing Flow
- Resolved: “Glad I could help today. You’ll receive an email shortly with next steps.”
- Pending: “I’ll note this down and arrange a follow-up from our team. You’ll hear from us soon.”
- Out of scope: “I’ll connect you with the right team so you’re taken care of.”

Data Capture Rules
- For any service request (loan, card, account opening), capture or confirm email; ask for preferred contact number if needed.

 Safety Notes
- Use the Knowledge Base as single source of truth.
- “Figures are indicative until verified by the bank.”

id: savings.doubleS
title: Sampath Double S Savings Account
category: Savings Account
product_area: accounts
requires_auth: false
last_reviewed: 2025-10-21
language: en
---

 Overview
Sampath Double S is a savings account that rewards customers with a monthly bonus interest for maintaining a healthy account balance. It is designed to encourage consistent savings growth.

What's Special
- Earn bonus interest calculated on the daily balance and credited monthly.
- To qualify for the bonus, an average balance of Rs. 15,000 per month must be maintained.
- Bonus interest will be paid for a maximum of one debit per interest cycle.

Eligibility
Available to Sri Lankan citizens over 18 years of age with valid identification (NIC or Passport).  
A minimum initial deposit of Rs. 5,000 is required.

 Account Requirements
- Minimum average balance to earn interest: Rs. 2,000  
- Minimum average balance to avoid service charge: Rs. 1,000  
- Bonus interest will not be paid if more than one debit occurs per interest cycle.

Branch Special Offers
- Bambalapitiya Branch: Minimum deposit Rs. 25,000  
- Colombo Super Branch: Minimum deposit Rs. 10,000

 Interest Calculation
The standard interest rate applies to all balances, plus bonus interest based on the tier above. Interest is calculated on the daily balance and credited monthly.

Key Features
- Monthly bonus interest on qualifying balances
- Access to Sampath Vishwa internet banking
- Sampath Visa or Master Debit Card included
- ATM and CDM access across the island
- SMS alerts and e-statements available

Overview
The Sampath Regular Savings Account is designed for individuals seeking a safe and accessible way to save money while earning interest. It allows customers to deposit funds and access them anytime through Sampath Bank's wide branch and ATM network.

Key Benefits
- Interest is paid monthly.
- Withdrawals and deposits can be made at any branch or ATM across the island.
- Sampath Vishwa internet banking and SMS alerts are available upon request.

 Eligible Card Categories
Customers receive an activated Sampath Visa or Master Debit Card at the time of account opening. Both Sampath Mastercard and Visa Credit & Debit Cards are supported.

Eligibility
Any Sri Lankan citizen over 18 years of age can open this account by providing a valid identification document such as a National Identity Card or Passport.

 Minimum Deposit and Balance
- Minimum initial deposit: Rs. 5,000  
- Minimum average balance to earn interest: Rs. 2,000  
- Minimum average balance to avoid service charges: Rs. 1,000

Interest Rate
The Regular Savings Account offers a standard interest rate of 2% per annum, calculated on the daily balance and credited monthly.

Savings Account Calculator

 Overview
Calculate the growth of your savings account based on:
- Initial deposit amount
- Monthly contribution
- Annual interest rate
- Time period (in months)

 Formula
The calculator uses compound interest formula:
- Future Value = Initial Deposit × (1 + r)^n + Monthly Deposit × [((1 + r)^n - 1) / r]
- Where r = monthly interest rate, n = number of months

Minimum Requirements
- Minimum initial deposit: LKR 1,000
- No minimum for monthly deposits

 Features
- Calculates total savings value
- Shows total interest earned
- Provides results in natural Sinhala pronunciation

 Usage
Ask: "මට ඉතිරිකිරීම් ගිණුමක් වර්ධනය ගණනය කරන්න පුළුවන්ද?"
Provide: Initial deposit, monthly deposit, interest rate, and time period

Example Calculations

 Example 1: Small Regular Savings
- Initial deposit: LKR 10,000
- Monthly deposit: LKR 5,000
- Interest rate: 8% per annum
- Period: 12 months
- Expected total: Approximately LKR 71,000 (including interest)

Example 2: Larger Investment
- Initial deposit: LKR 100,000

Example 3: Long-term Savings

- Expected total: Approximately LKR 650,000 (including interest)

Important Notes

- Please confirm with bank for exact figures
- All amounts will be provided in natural Sinhala pronunciation
